answers.answer: Yes, it looks like your blood sugar levels do look high. It should be at 100 or below when fasting. Has your Dr talked to you about the possibility of having diabetes? That could be the reason your soles are bothering you. Are you working with an Endocrinologist?  Remar

Hi,I agree with remar, your problem seems to bbe due to Diabetes, as I would affect blood circulation  due to thinning of blood vessels. Since how long you have the high blood glucose levels and are you taking any treatment for the same?Solace

HiThanks for the comments. I am not a diabetic, only in the beginning of this month the blood sugar level was slightly high i.e. 135 mg.  I again done blood sugar test in the middle of this month now this has come down to 107 mg. Doctor has not advised any medicine, only advised to stop taking sugar, sweets containing sugar, decide only after another test in next month. Is your Dr testing your blood sugar after you've fasted for 12 hours? Since you'll be going back next month to see your Dr ask him to check the blood pressure in your legs. Are you having any other symptoms like pain in your legs when walking?
Two other things that come to mind are a possible fungal infection or peripheral pressure. Did your Dr mention using a sole support in your shoes? You might want to give that a try.
